variables.description: The CIDR range to allow or deny, in CIDR notation (e.g., 172.16.0.0/24).
variables.name: CidrBlock

variables.description: Whether this rule applies to egress traffic from the subnet ("true") or ingress traffic to the                   subnet ("false").
variables.name: Egress

variables.description: The Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) code and type.
variables.name: Icmp
variables.required: Conditional required if specifying 1 (ICMP) for the protocol                   parameter.

variables.description: ID of the ACL where the entry will be created.
variables.name: NetworkAclId

variables.description: The range of port numbers for the UDP/TCP protocol.
variables.name: PortRange
variables.required: Conditional Required if specifying 6 (TCP) or 17 (UDP) for the protocol                parameter.

variables.description: The IP protocol that the rule applies to. You must specify -1 or a                   protocol number (go to Protocol Numbers at iana.org). You can specify -1 for all                   protocols.
variables.name: Protocol

variables.description: Whether to allow or deny traffic that matches the rule; valid values are "allow" or "deny".
variables.name: RuleAction

variables.description: Rule number to assign to the entry (e.g., 100). This must be a positive integer                   from 1 to 32766.
variables.name: RuleNumber
